data.title: Captain Edward Stopford RN
data.text:
Notes for Captain Edward Stopford RN

Baptism from the image of the Bishop’s Transcript, thanks Ancestry, transcript by me:

“ Account of Marriages Baptisms & Burials in the Parish of

“ Barton Seagrave

“ from May 1809 to May 1810

“. . . .

“ Baptisms

“Edward - Son of Richard Bruce & Eleanor Stopford was baptized October 8th 1809”

_____________________

BP reports “ Edward; b 20 Aug 1809; Capt RN; m 6 Aug 1840 Julia Maria (d 8

Aug 1924 aged 105), est dau of Capt William Wilbraham, RN, and d 14 Oct 1895”

_____________________

In 1851 they were at (?)Falconers Hill, North Street, Daventry, Northamptonshire:

First name(s) Last name Relationship Marital status Sex Age Birth year Occupation Birth place

Edward Stopford Head M M 41 1810 Commander, Royal Navy h p Barton Seagrave, Northants

Julia Stopford Wife M F 32 1819 - London, Middlesex

Edith Stopford Daur - F 7 1844 Scholar at home Herts, Harpenden

Grosvinor Stopford Son - M 6 1845 Scholar at home Herts, Bovingdon

Caroline Brard Gnss U F 24 1827 Governess Lanarkshire, Scotland

Anne Ball Serv U F 28 1823 Cook Warwicks, Badgeley End

Eleanor Henderson Serv U F 21 1830 Nurse London, Stb Paul’s Pimlico

Elizabeth Lamb Serv U F 27 1824 Housemaid Lincolnshire, Lincoln

Jane Cox Serv U F 18 1833 Kitchen maid Harleston, Northamptonshire

Thomas Esson Serv U M 19 1832 Footman Whilton, Northamptonshire

Henry Huthwaite Serv U M 23 1828 Groom Grantham, Lincolnshire

Ref:

Archive reference HO107

Piece number 1741

Folio 415

Page 40

Combined: 1851 ref: HO107, piece 1741, folio 415, p. 40

___________________

He was not found in 1861, 1871, 1881 censuses. Abroad?

In 1871 he was transcribed as Hopford and only found because they had their daughter staying with them and her married name was Kennedy. See her entry.

___________________

In 1891 they, with a daughter and grand-daughter, were at Ashby Road, Daventry, Northamptonshire:

First name(s) Last name Relationship Marital status Sex Age Birth year Occupation Birth place

Edward Stopford Head M M 81 1810 Capt RN. JP: Northants Northamptonshire

Julia M Stopford Wife M F 72 1819 - London, Middlesex

William R Kennedy SinL M M 53 1838 Admiral royal navy Italy

Edith L Kennedy Daur M F 47 1844 - Harpenden, Hertfordshire

Alice E Kennedy Gdau S F 20 1871 - Daventry, Northamptonshire

William Blackmore Serv S M 56 1835 Butler Clevedon, Somerset

Frederick Maisy Serv S M 15 1876 Page Sydenham

Annie E Austin Serv S F 25 1866 Cook India

Elizabeth Conning Serv S F 30 1861 Ladysmaid Scotland

Sylvia J Gee Serv S F 27 1864 Ladysmaid Daventry, Northamptonshire

Jane Niel Serv S F 29 1862 Housemaid Daventry, Northamptonshire

Jane Crofts Serv S F 21 1870 Housemaid Daventry, Northamptonshire

Ref:

Archive reference RG12

Piece number 1205

Folio 110

Page 29

Combined: 1891 ref: RG12, piece 1205, folio 110, p. 29

___________________

Getting together their children from public records is going to be difficult as there were two marriages between a male Stopford and a female Wilbrahim, on in 1840 and one in 1843, so their children overlap.

The way to disentangle this is to identify the couple who married in 1843 and then see what children the had in the 1851 and 1861 censuses.

The other couple were Robert Fanshawe Stopford and one of Emily Anne Wilbraham, Elspet Pringle, Louisa Shirley, Ellen Watson

But there was no sign of Robert F in 1851. Though in 1871 there was a Robert F and wife Lucy H with children born in these years:

Forename Birth Sex

Emily M 1847 F

Mary L 1855 F

Francis J 1858 M

Henrietta J 1860 F

Eleanor Anna 1863 F

But this got me nowhere!

So I tried to select baptisms between 1840 and 1860 with Parents names of Edward and Julia from Ancestry and this produced:

Bapt Birth Name Parents Father’s job Where

26 Jan 1842 3 Nov 1841 Henry Edward Edward & Julia Maria Capt R.N. St Geo, Han Sq

15 Jul 1843 17 Jun 1843 Edith Louisa Edward & Julia Maria Commander R.N. Harpenden, Herts

5 Jun 1845 15 Mar 1845 Grosvenor Edward & Julia Maria Capt R.N. St Geo Han Sq

And that was all - and exactly agreed with the births reported in Burke’s peerage.

It would have been better if Edith’s baptism had an image of the register/BT. But one was found on FindMyPast for a change, though only if you used the Hertfordshire data set, not if you used the All England or the data copied from Family Search.

___________________

His death index:

Name: Age at Death (in years):

STOPFORD, EDWARD 86

GRO Reference: 1895 D Quarter in DAVENTRY Volume 03B Page 63

___________________

Will notes for Captain Edward Stopford RN

His probate index:

1895

STOPFORD Edward of Falconer’s Hill house Daventry Northamptonshire captain royal navy died 14 October 1895 Probate London 14 December to Julia Maria Stopford widow Effects Â£5351 0s. 7d.

1383

Almost certainly he will have given it all to his wife. So not ordered.

__________________

Notes for Edward & Julia Maria (Family)
